alert.note: Alert for Northern Oneida; Southern Oneida (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued January 10 at 4:20PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, heavy lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches in northern Oneida County, and 3 to 6 inches for southern Oneida County. Storm total accumulations, including snow that has already fallen, will exceed 2 feet in parts of northern Oneida County. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Oneida County. * WHEN...For the Lake Effect Snow Warning, until 1 AM EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 1 AM to 10 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous snowfall could impact the evening commute today. The extreme wind chills will impact the morning commute Tuesday. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The lake effect snow band is expected to drop southward again this evening. Snowfall rates in the heaviest lake bands will be as high as 2 to 3 inches per hour. The heaviest snow accumulations will be in the northwestern portions of the county, and the lightest accumulations in the southeastern areas. Experimental content below...do not use operationally To view the experimental polygons please see: http://www.weather.gov/buf/lespolygon COORD...4332 7558 4342 7570 4346 7581 4342 7586 4331 7588 4331 7584 4318 7587 4317 7576 4323 7569 4322 7559 TIME Y22M01D11T0000Z-Y22M01D11T0600Z
info.instruction: The latest road conditions for New York can be found at 511ny.org, or by dialing 5 1 1 from within the state. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
